intro: Allantodia hirtipes, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed allantodia, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Native to tropical regions of Africa, it thrives in moist, shaded environments. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany and horticulture.
